content.raw:
I would hold up on this…

I'm totally fine with preferring `ign-cmake2` over `ign-cmake1`, and updating gtest should be fine.

But I would _strongly_ discourage migrating this repo to depend on C\+\+17 when we’re only using C\+\+11 features. The only thing that would do is limit its usability without offering any benefit.

Ideally, a build system should always express its minimal dependency so that the maximum number of users can take advantage of it. I understand that with the other ignition projects we fully intend to leverage C\+\+17 features, and I fully support that. But since we’re not using any of those features here \(and we don’t have any foreseeable plan to\), I don’t think it makes sense to lock this project’s build system into C\+\+17.
